text: Four of the ten most valued listed companies together added Rs 32,394.14 crore in market capitalisation last week, with HDFC Bank Ltd. and Reliance Industries Ltd. (RIL) gaining the most.The week also saw some temporary ups and downs in market capitalisation chart. Reliance Industries surged past Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. (TCS) briefly two times to become the most valued company last week. However, at close of the session on Tuesday and Friday the I.T. major reclaimed the top position.Also, in the past few days, a sort of musical chair game was played out between State Bank of India (SBI) and Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) for the tag of the most valued Public Sector Undertaking (PSU).At close on Friday, TCS stood at number one position in the domestic market capitalisation chart followed by RIL, HDFC Bank, ITC, HDFC, ONGC, SBI, Infosys, Indian Oil Corporation Ltd. (IOC) and Hindustan Unilever Ltd. (HUL).Among gainers, the market capitalisation of HDFC Bank zoomed Rs 14,709.01 crore to Rs 3,83,549.03 crore.RIL saw its market capitalisation surging by Rs 11,509.72 crore to Rs 4,55,105.33 crore and HDFC added Rs 5,131.39 crore to Rs 2,39,435.79 crore.The market capitalisation of IOC also moved up by Rs 1,044.02 crore to Rs 2,06,157.45 crore.Among losers, six companies lost a total Rs 29,117.26 crore in their market capitalisation last week.SBI's market capitalisation plummeted by Rs 7,177.22 crore to Rs 2,28,819.62 crore and that of ONGC tumbled Rs 6,673.28 crore to Rs 2,30,869.90 crore.The market capitalisation of ITC witnessed a drop of Rs 6,559.59 crore to Rs 3,33,263.45 crore and HUL lost Rs 3,657.76 crore to Rs 1,96,133.36 crore.TCS saw an erosion of Rs 3,280.76 crore to Rs 4,55,405.31 crore and Infosys (Rs 1,768.65 crore to Rs 2,12,168.78 crore).
title: Four Of The 10 Most Valued Companies Add Rs 32,394 Crore In Market Cap
